decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - 1.	The proposed LED advert panels and associated structure, by virtue of size, position, design and appearance would have an unacceptable impact on the amenity of the area. The size and scale of the adverts and structure would have an overbearing impact on pedestrians and cyclists at A4 level. The height of the structure is out of character with the immediate surrounding environment and would appear excessive on the skyline, adversely impacting on the amenity of the Great West Corridor and the amenity of the surrounding area. The structure is therefore contrary Planning Policy Guidance 19, Circular 03/2007 and policies ENV-B.1.1 (New Development), ENV-B.1.3 (High Buildings or Structures in areas other than those listed in ENV-B.1.2), ENV-B.1.4 (Advertisements), ENV-P.1.7 (Light Pollution), ENV-N.2.9 (Green Corridors) of the Unitary Development Plan and Policies BAAP1 (Sustainable Development), BAAP2 (Urban Design) and BAAP 4 (The Great West Road) of the Brentford Area Action Plan.

Condition : 2 - 2.	The proposed LED advert panels and associated structure, by virtue of size, scale and location in close proximity to the advert being constructed at 1053 Great West Road would have an adverse cumulative impact on the amenity of the surrounding environment. The location of two illuminated LED panels at a high level and approximately 20m apart would adversely impact on the amenity of the area and the Great West Road corridor. The proposal is therefore contrary to Planning Policy Guidance 19, Circular 03/2007 and policies ENV-B.1.1 (New Development), ENV-B.1.3 (High Buildings or Structures in areas other than those listed in ENV-B.1.2), ENV-B.1.4 (Advertisements), ENV-P.1.7 (Light Pollution), ENV-N.2.9 (Green Corridors) of the Unitary Development Plan and Policies BAAP1 (Sustainable Development), BAAP2 (Urban Design) and BAAP 4 (The Great West Road) of the Brentford Area Action Plan.

Condition : 3 - 3.	The proposed advert panels and structure, represent a potential distraction to motorists on a carriageway where caution is required, which would be detrimental to road safety conditions on the M4 elevated motorway, and would adversely impact on public safety in accordance with the Town & Country Planning (Control of Advertisement) Regulations 2007, Circular 03/2007, Planning Policy Guidance 19 and would also be contrary to Policies ENV-B.1.1 (New Development), ENV-B.1.4 (Advertisements) and T.4.4 (Road Safety) of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan and Brentford Area Action Plan Policy 4.

Condition : 4 - 4.	The proposed LED advert panels and structure, represent a potential distraction to motorists on a carriageway where caution is required. The frequency of changes of display, or method of change has not been specified in the application and as a result the LED screens are considered to potentially distract motorists on the elevation M4 motorway. Accordingly, the proposal fails to have due regard for public safety in accordance with the Town & Country Planning (Control of Advertisement) Regulations 2007, Circular 03/2007, Planning Policy Guidance 19 and would also be contrary to Policies ENV-B.1.1 (New Development), ENV-B.1.4 (Advertisements) and T.4.4 (Road Safety) of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan and Brentford Area Action Plan Policy 4.
description: Erection of a structure and advert consent with two internally illuminated LED post panels.
